children.name: postgraduate
children.definition: / graduatemainly US  describes university studies or students at a more advanced level than a first degree: sau đại học, cao học
examples: postgraduate studies/ research/ students
a postgraduate degreeinmicrobiology

children.name: vocational
children.definition: vocational training or schools teach you the skills to do a particular job: nghề
examples: Not all the courses are purely vocational.
The Job Corps is a vocational training program for low-income youths.
The Swedes regard vocationaltrainingas a part of a youngster's education.

children.name: secondary
children.definition: relating to the education of children approximately between the ages of 11 and 18 years old: trung học
examples: secondary education/ schooling/ teaching etc
secondaryeducation
Marcus has just started at secondaryschool.

children.name: higher education
children.definition: education at a university or similar institution: giáo dục đại học
examples: The U.S. community college system is the largest system of higher education in the world.
More women than ever are going on to higher education.
I did a carpentry course at the further education college.
further education[U]UK(abbFE) education for adults after leaving school, that is not at a university
tertiary educationC1[U] formaleducation at a college, university etc

children.name: education
children.definition: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university:
examples: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
efforts to improve girls’ access to education
education[U] the institutions and people involved with teaching :
the local education authority
tertiary educationC1[U] formaleducation at a college, university etc
educational[usually attri adj] [B2] relating to education:giáo dục
Different children have different educational needs.
We offer a wide range of educational and sporting activities.
educational institution/establishmenta school, college, or universitycơ sở giáo dục
Many educational institutions have not been able make needed improvements because of funding cuts.
educational system
The American educational system is in need of reform.
educational opportunity
Low-income children do not have the same educational opportunities as children from wealthier families.

children.name: a good education
examples: All parents want a good education for their children.

children.name: a poor education
children.definition: not very good
examples: She had a poor education, and left school without qualifications.

children.name: an all-round education
children.definition: including a balance of lots of different subjects
examples: The school offers a good all-round education.

children.name: full-time education
children.definition: spending every weekday in a school or college
examples: Children must stay in full-time education until the age of 16.

children.name: state educationBritish English,public educationAmerican English
children.definition: provided by the government of a country
examples: The state of California guarantees free public education to all children.

children.name: private education
children.definition: that people have to pay for
examples: I don't agree with the principle of private education.

children.name: formal educationC1
children.definition: from teachers at school or college, rather than learning by yourself
examples: She had no formal education and was brought up by her grandmother.

children.name: primary
children.definition: school
examples: educationBritish English,elementary educationAmerican English(= for children aged between 5 and 11 )The government has announced plans to improve the quality of primary school education.

children.name: secondary education
children.definition: alsohigh school educationAmerican English
examples: (= for children aged between 11 and 18 )She hopes to start a teaching career in secondary education.

children.name: university/college education
examples: Do you have a university education?

children.name: further/higher education
children.definition: at a college or university
examples: I did a carpentry course at the further education college.

children.name: adult education
children.definition: for adults
examples: They run adult education classes at the local community college.

children.name: vocational education
children.definition: relating to skills needed for a particular job
examples: We offer vocational education and job training.

children.name: nursery/pre-school education
children.definition: for children aged under 5
examples: The funding will provide nursery education for all four-year-olds.

children.name: have an education
examples: The women have had little education.

children.name: get/receive an education
examples: Some children grow up without receiving any education.

children.name: give/provide an education
examples: The school aims to provide a good general education.

children.name: enter education
children.definition: start going to school, college etc
examples: The number of students entering higher education has risen.

children.name: leave educationBritish English
children.definition: stop going to school, college etc
examples: She left full-time education at the age of 16.

children.name: continue your education
examples: I hope to continue my education after high school.

children.name: the education system
children.definition: the way education is organized and managed in a country
examples: Is the British education system failing some children?

children.name: the education department
children.definition: the government organization that makes decisions about education
examples: Newcastle City Council’s education department

children.name: an education authority
children.definition: a government organization that makes official decisions about education in one particular area
examples: The school is funded by the local education authority.

children.name: the education service
children.definition: all the government organizations that work together to provide education
examples: There are plans to expand the adult education service.

children.name: education policy
children.definition: political plans for managing an education system
examples: The teaching unions are calling for the government to review its education policy.

children.name: education reform
children.definition: changes that a government makes to the education system in a country
examples: the government’s programme of education reform

children.name: schooling
children.definition: education at school: giáo dục ở nhà trường
examples: Jack didn'treceivemuchformalschooling.

children.name: children in their final year ofcompulsory schooling(= the time during which children have to attend school by law )
examples: Al’s dad had only a few years of schooling.

children.name: academic
children.definition: 1 relating to education, especially at college or university levelOPP non-: học thuật
examples: He possessed no academic qualifications.
a program to raise academic standards
2[ usually before noun ] concerned with studying from books, as opposed to practical work : học thuật hơn là thực hành
the study of art as an academic discipline

children.name: academic qualifications
examples: He had the right experience and academic qualifications for the job.

children.name: academic performance
examples: Personal problems may affect a student’s academic performance.

children.name: academic achievements
examples: Girls’ academic achievements are at least as good as boys’.

children.name: academic standards
children.definition: levels that are considered to be acceptable
examples: The school has high academic standards.

children.name: academic research
children.definition: study of a subject, in order to discover new facts or test new ideas
examples: Many academic research projects take years to complete.

children.name: academic study
examples: After academic study, you have to gain practical experience.

children.name: an academic subject
examples: Children who are not good at academic subjects may excel in music or sport.

children.name: an academic discipline
children.definition: a subject that is studied at university
examples: the academic disciplines of linguistics, psychology and sociology

children.name: an academic career
examples: She wanted to pursue an academic career.

children.name: the academic year
children.definition: the time within a period of 12 months when students are studying at a school or university
examples: Language students spend the third academic year abroad.

children.name: the academic world
children.definition: the institutions, people etc involved in education
examples: In the academic world, the theory was received less approvingly.

children.name: academic freedom
children.definition: the freedom to study what you want
examples: There is concern for the academic freedom of both staff and students.

children.name: grant
children.definition: money that the government gives to someone to help them pay for their education: trợ cấp (giáo dục)
examples: Will I get a grant, even though both my parents are earning?

children.name: student grant: học bổng
examples: Without a student grant, I’d never even have gone into higher education.

children.name: scholarship
children.definition: money that a student received from theirschool,collegeetc to pay for their education, especially because they have passed a special examination: học bổng
examples: The Foundation’s goals include providing scholarships for gifted young students.
Admitted to Mills College on a full scholarship, she graduated Phi Beta Kappa without a penny of help from her parents.

children.name: scholarship to
examples: Shewonascholarshipto Iowa State University.

children.name: college scholarship
examples: The company has a small number of college scholarships to offer to employees’ children.

children.name: athletic/drama/music etc scholarshipa scholarship given to sb who is very good at sport, acting, music etc
examples: I attended the University of Houston on an athletic scholarship.
At 9, he became a boy soprano, beginning a six-year music scholarship in a cathedral choir.

children.name: win/be awarded a scholarship
examples: When she was 18, she won a scholarship to study at the Conservatoire in Paris.
We’re very proud of the five students from this school who were awarded scholarships.

children.name: on a scholarship
examples: He attended college on a drama scholarship.

children.name: graduation
children.definition: 1 the time when you complete a university degree course or your education at an American high school:
examples: After graduation Neil returned to Ohio.
On graduation(= after completing a first degree ), Nancy became an art teacher.
2[U] a ceremony at which you receive a university degree or a diploma from an American high school :
graduation day
a graduation ceremony
